examples.text: he seems so calm amid all the rushing people

definitions: (of air or a liquid) flowing strongly

examples.text: responders attempted to shut off the rushing water

definitions: (of a player) advancing rapidly toward an offensive player, especially the quarterback

examples.text: one of the interceptions came on a pass that deflected off the knee of a rushing lineman

definitions: (of a play, player, etc.) characterized by gaining yardage or scoring a touchdown or conversion due to a player running from scrimmage with the ball

examples.text: he scored a rushing touchdown on the 4th down
he is becoming the best rushing quarterback in NFL history

definitions: the action of moving with urgent haste

examples.text: despite all the rushing and hustling, we still feel on Christmas there is something wonderful about life

shortDefinitions: action of moving with urgent haste

definitions: the action of advancing rapidly toward an offensive player, especially the quarterback

examples.text: there is no defensive rushing allowed during the kick

shortDefinitions: action of advancing rapidly towards opposing player

definitions: the action of gaining yardage or scoring a touchdown or conversion by running from scrimmage with the ball

examples.text: they have a really good offensive line as far as rushing is concerned

shortDefinitions: action of gaining yardage by running from scrimmage with ball

definitions: the process in which a college student visits a fraternity or sorority with a view toward joining it

examples.text: rushing is a popular option for first- and second-year students

shortDefinitions: process in which college students visits fraternity
